Become A #YellowFellow

#YellowFellow is an award winning CRY campaign that aims to mobilize people to raise awareness for every child’s right to a happy childhood.

All you need to do is wear/use yellow socks in as unique, creative and quirky way as possible and post a photo of yourself on your social media using the hashtag #YellowFellow and tagging CRY.

Build Your Career At CRY

We believe in the power of every individual’s potential and rely on the values of justice and equity to drive our work culture. 

Our longest serving employee has worked in CRY for over 31 years so we’re clearly doing something right that resonates with our people – and that is making a real difference!

Manager / Senior Manager- Monitoring & Evaluation (Bangalore)

Bangalore

Function / Division: Development Support

Location: Bangalore

Reporting to: Programme Head in the Region

Position Summary:
This person will be central to the Monitoring and Evaluation system at the Regions. He/ she will consolidate, monitor progress achieved against pre-decided indicators pertaining to CRY objectives as part of CRY’s M & E system. He/ she will generate disaggregated reports as required for various purposes. He/ She will have to liaise with internal and external stakeholders for data acquisition and will be the regional hub for all information related to impact.

Key responsibilities:

  • Maintain the regional data based on Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability and Learning (MEAL) by following up with partners on data collected by them regarding MEAL
  • Generate reports from the MEAL, provide a disaggregated analysis of the data in terms of theme, state, age, gender, community etc.
  • Be the focal point for any data related to MEAL in the region for the queries from any other functions within CRY.
  • Provide periodic feedback to partners on the quality of data collected, timeliness of data collected as per MEAL guidelines.
  • Consolidate and provide analysis from various formats that are part of MEAL system in the context of programme monitoring and evaluation ex Field Visit Report (FVR) , Annual Evaluation Report (AER)
  • Share the red flags with the regional Development Support (DS) and prepare narratives on the analysis in coordination with the respective state teams and region PH.
  • Capacity building of partners on basics of data analysis and data management.
  • Provide support to the Research Sub-Function of Policy, Research, Advocacy and Documentation (PRAD) towards any national research commissioned by way of supervising regional data collection, quality control of data collection etc.
  • Support any regional level research by state teams in conjunction with Program Head and AGM Research.
  • Work with and provide insights through analysis of program related data from regional team and partners in the region and undertake secondary data analysis on various themes as required from time to time.
  • Ensure quality and accuracy of evidence generated by regional program team for all advocacy purposes as required.

Qualification:
Degree / Post-graduation in Social Sciences/Social Work/Statistics. 7 to 9 years of experience in M &E role in the development sector

Skill sets required:

  • Data analysis and interpretation
  • Team Player with an orientation to play a supportive role
  • Ability to communicate effectively in writing
  • Proficiency in MS Excel, data analysis and cleaning is a must. Working knowledge of Tableau preferred. Knowledge of other tools like SPSS or SAS would be an added advantage.

Write in:
Please email your application to careers@crymail.org mentioning the location applied for.

Manager – Human Resources (Delhi)

Delhi

Function / Division: Human Resources

Location: Delhi

About CRY:
CRY is India’s most trusted NGO working on the issue of child rights for the last 42 years. Over the years CRY has impacted the lives of over 3 million children in India. CRY has many firsts to her credit over the years in Resource Generation, Development Support, Brand Communications, People practices, and Finance. CRY’s reach is Pan India with a presence in 19 states. CRY works to ensure happier childhoods for India’s children.

Your Challenge:
At CRY – Child Rights and You, the leading Indian Child Rights organisation, every single person works towards creating a more just world for children. At CRY, you’ll be using your professional skills and experience to help restore to underprivileged Indian children their basic rights to – survival, development, protection and participation. CRY has a holistic approach to development based on the child rights framework with community empowerment as a key ingredient. CRY also places strong emphasis on networking with other NGOs and advocacy efforts to influence macro policies for children.

The Role:
You will be the face of Human Resources in the region. Your responsibilities include Talent Acquisition for the Region, Employee Engagement, Performance Management, Documentation and updation of data and employee records. You will also assist in maintenance of training records and feedback, provide support for Talent Acquisition for other regions when necessary and help in coordination for HR workshops in the region. You will also support the Talent Management process in the region. Provide HR support to the region in line with business requirements and HR functional strategy. Ensure HR strategy, policies and systems are implemented in the region. Organize culture building and workplace climate improvement and ensure resolving conflicts, regional meetings, open forums, create spaces for get-togethers etc. The position requires a lot of communication with all functions of in the region.

You:
You should be a Graduate/ Post Graduate in management specialising in HR with 6-7 years of experience in generalist HR role. Excellent communication skills and understanding of human resources issues is required. You should also have knack of building relationships with various stakeholders.

Write in:
Please email your updated resumes to careers@crymail.org mentioning your current & expected CTC.

Associate / Assistant Manager – Programme Operations (Bangalore)

Bangalore

Function / Division: Development Support

Location: Bangalore

About CRY:
CRY is India’s most trusted NGO working on the issue of child rights for the last 42 years. Over the years CRY has impacted the lives of over 3 million children in India. CRY has many firsts to her credit over the years in Resource Generation, Development Support, Brand Communications, People practices, and Finance. CRY’s reach is Pan India with a presence in 19 states. CRY works to ensure happier childhoods for India’s children.

Your Role:
This role is responsible for providing Program Operation support to DS Region. It includes administrative and database maintenance support to the DS function in order to ensure compliance with basic systems and processes of CRY and to make sure that DS-related information is always up to date and available for use by internal and external stakeholders. The role also ensures sanctions, disbursals, and audit requirements are completed on a timely basis. The role also ensures providing administrative support to all CRY-led Direct Intervention Projects which includes ensuring due diligence to the financial guidelines, timely processing of invoices and expenditure settlements, and DI SOPs.

Technical skills:

  • Grant-making and sanction processing skills.
  • MS Office using skills – Person who has the knowledge of word, excel, and PowerPoint and has experience in working with excel spreadsheets, preparing, consolidating, and generating reports /analysis from the spreadsheets (trend and comparative analysis) and working on basic formulas.
  • Maintaining database and generating various reports – Persons who have the ability to maintain database, both soft and hard copy documentation, maintain statutory documentation for systems records and audit purposes.
  • Coordinate with finance and provide required information/documents for statutory audits.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, and interpersonal skills.
  • A team player who is supportive, flexible, and ready to take on additional tasks and ability to cope with work pressure. The person who has the ability to work well in a team, build good rapport, work closely/follow up on various requirements with various stakeholders and is also flexible to take on different responsibilities as required by the organization from time to time.
  • Responds positively to feedback and respects diverse points of view and constructive attitude.
  • Ability to identify problems, analyze their causes, and resolve them in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Possess a high-energy level and strong work ethic with a commitment to continuous improvement, a sense of personal responsibility for work outcomes, and a personal commitment to meeting deadlines Excellent organizational skills, ability to multitask, organize/plan and execute the work with timelines, co-ordinate with different stakeholders internally (DS team, other functions particularly finance, HO, RD, RC members, Grant Risk Management, etc.) and externally (Project partners).
  • Basic knowledge or openness to learn and work on financial/sanction-related software.

You:
You must hold a Graduate / Post – Graduate in any discipline and have 3 to 6 years of experience in the Development Sector. Fluency and articulation of the English language are a must. Knowing any other South Indian languages would be desirable.

Write in:
Please email your application to careers@crymail.org mentioning your preferred location & the post applied for.

Associate – Graphic Design (Mumbai)

Mumbai

Function / Division: Communications

Location: Mumbai

About CRY
CRY is India’s most trusted NGO working on the issue of child rights for the last 42 years. Over the years CRY has impacted the lives of over 3 million children in India. CRY has many firsts to her credit over the years in Resource Generation, Development Support, Brand Communications, People practices, and Finance. CRY’s reach is Pan India with a presence in 19 states. CRY works to ensure happier childhoods for India’s children.

Position Summary:
This position will manage design strategy and execution for CRY India and will work as a part of the brand team. Core responsibilities include conceptualizing and creating brand/social media campaigns, donor/volunteer communication, digital designs as well as event/activations branding. Increasing CRY brand visibility and recall and creating awareness around child rights will be a critical measure of this role. As a member of the Communications function, you will act as a brand custodian and ensure that all brand guidelines are adhered to.

Education, Skills & Experience:

  • Academic training in graphic design and visual communications
  • Minimum 2-3 years of experience with a creative agency or design studio or as a freelancer
  • Proficiency with Adobe Suite (Illustrator and Photoshop primarily) & InDesign is a must. Formats – Photo edits, Illustrations, adapts.
  • Basic knowledge in video creations with Adobe Effects/ Premier Pro.
  • Knowledge of photography is an asset

Write in:
Please email your application and link to your portfolio mentioning the post applied for, or write in for more details to careers@crymail.org

Sr. Manager – Data Analytics

Bangalore

Function / Division: Resource Development / HO

Location: Bangalore

At CRY, we take the ‘You’ of Child Rights and You very seriously; and not without reason. In 2013-14 alone, with support from our patrons, we have been able to reach out to over 9 lakh children in 4,557 slums and villages across this country.

This is the journey that started over 420 years by an inspired individual who believed in the power of collective action to bring about lasting change for children. CRY as an umbrella NGO chooses to restore rights of the most marginalized children via partnerships that provide thematic, financial, and logistical and management inputs to over 200 grassroots organizations working in the area of child rights.

Today, CRY has made an enduring difference to the lives of more than 2 million Indian children and the key driving force behind CRY’s endeavor is the commitment and passion of its teams. We invite you to be a part of this driving force.

Your Challenge:
The support of countless individual donors across India and the world over who believe in child rights, keeps CRY going and achieves demanding goals for children.

You will be providing insights to the RG team by analyzing donor data, trends and donor behaviors that enables RG Team in meeting its fund requirements.

Your Role:
You are responsible for managing the individual engagement model of CRY for raising resources towards CRY’s objectives by providing insights to the RG team by analyzing donor data, trends and donor behaviors. Devise and suggest new strategies for individual donor engagement, monitor performance and suggest course corrections and thereby increase the effectiveness of resource mobilization teams.

  • Analysis of national/regional donor data/donation trends, sharing insights, recommending priority intervention areas and means. Mapping of different donor touch points and its response to identify patterns
  • Understand and identify the functional requirements for MIS – Responsible for design, generation and modification of the RG MIS-Incomes and costs/ Analytics reports to ensure a well-functioning system for timely tracking of RG performance IP and CP. To analyze data, assess trends and share insights
  • Build synergies and increase efficiencies in existing analytic operations
  • Institute systems and processes aimed at increasing efficiencies in analytic operations
  • Ensure compliance to agreed processes
  • Understand the requirements of the function and customize the BI reports to suit the functional needs
  • Assist the regions with analytic support, share insights and propose action points. Track implementation of those action points and its outcome
  • Monitor costs of the function through cost MIS, identify patterns and report
  • Assist regions with the data/analysis requirements, ensure adherence to the set processes/formats, validation and uploading it in FMS

You:
You must be a Graduate / Post-Graduate, preferably Degree/Diploma in Data Management/Business Administration/Management with 6-8 years’ experience in retail sector responsible for customer/donor analytics with an understanding of Business Intelligence tools and its applications. You should have a good knowledge and experience in Advanced excel and SQL knowledge.

Write in:
Please email your application mentioning the post applied for, or write in for more details to careers@crymail.org

Senior Manager – Corporate Partnerships

Mumbai

Function / Division: Resource Generation

Location: Mumbai

About CRY:
CRY is India’s most trusted NGO working on the issue of child rights for the last 42 years. Over the years CRY has impacted the lives of over 3 million children in India. CRY has many firsts to her credit over the years in Resource Generation, Development Support, Brand Communications, People practices, and Finance. CRY’s reach is Pan India with a presence in 19 states. CRY works to ensure happier childhoods for India’s children.

Your challenges:
Did you ever think that meeting new people, generating new ideas that lead to business opportunities could change children’s lives? At CRY – Child Rights and You, your job experience matters in a whole new way….. you do what you do best in order to create a better world for Indian children. At CRY we guarantee that every employee feels valued and experiences a unique sense of satisfaction in the work that he/she does.We have opportunities tailor-made for people with drive, intelligence and the urge to face new challenges. In short, we’re offering something no corporate posting could – the chance to combine professional skills and growth with the opportunity to make a difference in children’s lives by creating an ever growing base of committed clients. If you agree with us that this work will be exceptionally rewarding, then CRY is looking for you…

Your role:
As a person in this postion, you need to be highly driven, and take ownership and responsibility for the following:

  • Establishing connect with corporates in your location to identify opportunites to partner with CRY for its objectives and activities.
  • You will be responsible for acquiring new corporates and for ensuring their commitment to CRY by working closely with them to meet their child rights agenda.
  • Managing the relationship with our retention clients, communicating regularly about the work done, thereby creating long term supporters for CRY
  • Carrying out research work on the corporate segment in the region in order to create a pipleline for reach outs
  • Creating proposals and presentations, to be used as effective pitching tools while connecting to the corporates.
  • Managing the portfolio of clients to convert on income & maintain relationships; with a mix of retention & acquisition accounts

In doing so you’ll experience the thrill of generating ideas and meeting new people in the coporate world and you will enhance your relationship building skills by engaging with existing clients.

You will experience a new high and a new challenge every single day as you manage your portfolio and find innovative ways to raise funds from corporates. But most of all, you’ll experience a level of job satisfaction you may never experience anywhere else. Because your success will give millions of children the right to live, learn and enjoy the simple joys of childhood.

You:
You must be a Post-Graduate, preferably an MBA with 7-9 years of experience in Client Acquisition/Client Servicing/Business Development/B2B Sales having strong communication skills along with an ability to take initiatives and a drive to achieve results.

Write in:
Please email your application mentioning the post applied for, or write in for more details to careers@crymail.org

Consultant – Donor Relationship HNI

Delhi, Mumbai

Function / Division: Resource Development

Location: Delhi, Mumbai

About CRY:
Recognized as Indias most trusted NGO, Child Rights and You (CRY) works tirelessly to ensure happier and healthier childhoods for India’s underprivileged children. We address children’s critical needs by working with parents, teachers, Anganwadi workers, communities, district and state level governments as well as the children themselves. Over the last 4 decades, we have impacted the lives of over 3 million children across 19 states in India.

This role will drive high value donor portfolio, calling, engaging, and meetiing with portfolio donors to ensure retention and upgrades. This person will also work to create personalized communication and create programmes that will build relations with HNIs. He/she will also build relations to get new references and create giving circle.

Job Responsibilities:

  1. Engaging with donors to meet monthly and annual income targets.
  2. Creation of customized communication for HNIs
  3. Ensure donor upgrades and new references
  4. Provide support in acquiring HNIs
  5. Design relationship programmes for donors
  6. Donor profiling , and scoping of opportunities
  7. Handle donor queries/ grievances.
  8. Manage relevant documentation and approvals for the function

Skills & Experience:

  • Academic training in Graduate/ Post graduate
  • 4 to 7 years of experience in sales/ marketing and at least 2-3 years of HNI interface
  • Proficiency in handling sales/ Customer Relationship Profile in Bank/Insurance/Telecom

Write in:
Please email your application to careers@crymail.org mentioning the post applied for on the subject line. Also please mention the name of the website where you have seen the advertisement.

Consultant Telecaller ( Bangalore, Mumbai & Delhi )

Bangalore, Mumbai & Delhi

Job Title: Consultant Telecaller ( Bangalore, Mumbai & Delhi )

Function/Division: Resource Development

Location: Bangalore, Mumbai & Delhi

About CRY:

CRY is India’s most trusted NGO working on the issue of child rights for the last 42 years. Over the years CRY has impacted the lives of over 3 million children in India. CRY has many firsts to her credit over the years in Resource Generation, Development Support, Brand Communications, People practices, and Finance. CRY’s reach is Pan India with a presence in 19 states. CRY works to ensure happier childhoods for India’s children.

Your challenges:

We would you like to use your talent and skills for the cause! Are you a fluent and confident communicator? If yes, then read on…CRY – Child Rights and You is a national level premier Non Government Organisation working towards ensuring lasting change for rights of Children of our country. For almost 40 years, CRY and its 200 partner NGOs have worked with parents and communities to ensure lasting change in the lives of over 2,000,000 underprivileged children across 23 states in India.

Your role:

We are looking for dedicated and energetic telecallers consultant at our Bangalore office as part of our resource development team. Your job would be to interact with our donors (existing and potential) and contributing towards generating resources.

You:

You should be a graduate with minimum 1-2 years of experience in any Telecalling agency or BPO or customer service. You should have good communication in Telegu/Tamil/Kanadaand & English and knowledge of basic computer applications.

I was the youngest person in the organization when I had joined many years back and ever since then, CRY has held me, groomed me, mentored me and taught me to give every task my full potential. “CRY allows you to grow and develop both as a professional and as an individual. It is a people centric organisation with a prime focus on its human capital in every function. It stands apart from other employers because it enables us to balance our work life seamlessly. In all, a great place to work for!”

Vidya DeoSenior Manager, HR

 

“I have been a part of CRY for a little over 6 months now and so far, the journey has been memorable. The charged work environment, amazing colleagues and the freedom to execute ideas at all levels makes it an exciting place to work!”

“CRY has given me the opportunity to work with some incredible minds in marketing and communication design who share their knowledge and help me do my best. Moreover, CRY is like an extended family and every colleague shares a camaraderie that is unique. Individual talents and achievements are consistently recognized and every person is given a chance to grow their potential. I love being a part of something larger that makes a difference. It is my great privilege to work with CRY!”
